text: The East Lancs Flyte was a single-decker body of a bus, It had a step entrance, It was built from 1996 to 2001 by East Lancashire Coachbuilders. It was built on the Scania L113CRL chassis, Scania K112CRB chassis, Scania K113CRB chassis, Volvo B6 chassis (photo), Leyland Tiger chassis, Volvo B10M chassis, KIRN Mogul chassis and Yorkshire Traction chassis. East Lancs misspelled bus names on purpose (naming it "Flyte" instead of "Flight") In 2000, It was replaced by the East Lancs Myllennium-based Hyline. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:Full-size buses Flyte
title: East Lancs Flyte
